file_content.text: Is there trouble, Master Kaedan?
No, Admiral. My guests have simply arrived sooner than expected. Rest assured, this war can only end one way.
You're very confident for someone who's cornered.
Don't boast.
Cornered? Hardly.
I was hired to kill you, that's all.
The war's not my business.
You just do your job, but do you ever stop to question what that job means?
Have you ever considered coming over to the dark side?
You could always turn.
Many times, but only in the hopes of destroying every Sith in existence.
The Empire demands your termination.
Yes, with your death. [Attack]
I'll show the Empire what it can do with its demands.
You know your options, Master Kaedan. Surrender. Save a life.
I'll give you one chance.
I opposed the Treaty of Coruscant. Why should I surrender now, when circumstances are looking much brighter?
Who is that you're talking to?
Introductions, please
No one you'll live to meet.
You are on Jedi land, and I'm only going to ask once for you to leave.
The Sith take what the Jedi are too weak to keep.
You want it? Defend it.
I knew darkness obscured the vision, but I never imagined anyone could be so blind.
This place seems badly kept for such vital land. Maybe a thousand years ago it belonged to the Jedi, but right now, it's up for grabs.
Jedi land? I doubt that.
I would expect you of all people to understand the significance of this place.
I have a counter proposal. You disappear, and the Empire will show mercy to you and your soldiers.
I think you should leave.
A generous proposal, but we both know I could never accept it.
If you're done talking, I'd like to do what I was paid to do.
It's nothing personal.
Surely even a bounty hunter understands sacred things? The job, the hunt?
What do you mean I'm "on Jedi land"?
Jedi land?
The Jedi have built their temples here for years. These ruins are sites of pilgrimage and meditation.
If you thought you could win, you would've attacked by now.
What's the matter? Afraid?
A Jedi must seek the path of peace, first.
The crystals your Empire hopes to turn into a weapon of mass murder are visible signs of an invisible truth. The Force.
A Jedi does not kill until forced. I would sooner kill every Imperial on Ilum than allow these crystals to be desecrated.
It will be a pleasure, killing you.
I'm going to enjoy this.
I hope to deny you as much pleasure as I possibly can.
Those crystals are no more sacred than my ear.
What a bunch of nonsense.
I almost feel sorry for you.
Then you'll die for something you believe in.
I almost hate to kill you.
One with the Force, I will be even stronger.
Troopers, join me. For the Republic.
